titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the first half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) The Sǝnkǝssar for the first half of the year (fols. 3ra-226vc) I-1) Mäskäräm (fols. 3ra-38rc) I-2) Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 38va-69vc) I-3) Ḫǝdar (fols. 69vc-103rb) I-4) Taḫśaś (fols. 103rb-144vc) I-5) Ṭǝrr (fols. 144vc-192rb) I-6) Yäkkatit (fols. 192rc-226vb) The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Additiones 1-12; colophon.

donors.donor:
The name of the original donor Tälawe Krǝstos (fol. 226vb), has been erased throughout the Ms (sometimes the first letter of his name remained, e.g. fol. 69vb l.14). According to Additio 12, the Ms. was bought by priests ʾabunä Wäldä Mikaʾel and his son ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot and donated to the church of Yoḥannǝs Mäṭmǝq Dǝbla. The names of the donors, and other names (of their relatives?), are written in the supplication formulas in a recent hand: Wäldä Mikaʾel (e.g., fols. 4ra, 5rc, 5vc), Täklä Haymanot (fols. 3ra, 5va, 6rc), (ʾAmätä) Ṣädalä Maryam (fols. 6ra, 32ra, 57va), Wälättä Kidan (fols. 31va, 68vc, 172vc), Wäldä Yoḥannǝs (fols. 82ra, 87ra, 88rc), Gäbrä ʾArägawi (fols. 82ra, 91ra, 129vc), Gäbrä Yoḥannǝs (fols. 84rb), Mäzgäbä Śǝllase (fols. 151ra, 152rc, 156ra), Wäldä Giyorgis (fols. 172vb, 182rc, 191vb), Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer (fols. 198vc, 208ra, 209rc).
The same names are indicated in Ms. DMD-009; some of the names are found in Ms. DMD-012.

dcomments.dcomment: The name of King ʾIyasu I (r. 1682-1706) is mentioned throughout the Ms. The name of the original donor, Tälawe Krǝstos, is known in connection with King ʾIyasu I. Additio 12 mentions ras Sǝbḥat (ʾArägawi, governor of Tǝgray in the years 1892-95 and 1908-14).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has possibly been rebound. Many fols. are stained with water. Fol. 220 is damaged by rodents, with minor loss of text. Traces of one stitch repair on fols. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 (?).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: criss-cross, triple line fillet, double circle, interlaced line fillet, wave form with eye, x-from).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Short parchment guards are inserted in the centre fold of some quires (fols. 84-85, 85-86, 144-145, 154-155, 223-224, 227-228).

txfolios.txfolio: On fol. 85r, a part of the text is not visible (the corner is folded).

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub after 1/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(9; s.l. 1, stub after 9/fols. 11r-19v) – III(12/fols. 20r-31v) – IV(10/fols. 32r-41v) – V(10/fols. 42r-51v) – VI(10/fols. 52r-61v) – VII(10/fols. 62r-71v) – VIII(10/fols. 72r-81v) – IX(8/fols. 82r-89v) – X(10/fols. 90r-99v) – XI(10/fols. 100r-109v) – XII(10/fols. 110r-119v) – XII(10/fols. 120r-129v) – XIII(10/fols. 130r-139v) – XIV(10/fols. 140r-149v) – XV(10/fols. 150r-159v) – XVI(10/fols. 160r-169v) – XVII(10/fols. 170r-179v) – XVIII(10/fols. 180r-189v) – XIX(10/fols. 190r-199v) – XX(10/fols. 200r-209v) – XXI(11; s.l.: 11, no stub/fols. 210r-220v) – XXII(6/221r-226v) – B(2/fols. 227r-228v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1E-1E-1E1E-1E1E/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Mediocre but careful, but upright and perpendicular.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The rubrics are written in a finer hand, very slim and slender.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors and other individuals mentioned in supplication formulas, the name of King ʾIyasu; a few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of each section of the text; two initial lines of the first commemorative notice of the day and one initial line of the subsequent commemorative notices; the word sälam “salutation” opening the ʾarke-hymns; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

colophon.det: The colophon is only partly readable, since the passages containing the names have been erased.

additional.cont: Fol. 31vab: ˀArke-poem (for St. Mercury of Rome?).
additional.det: Written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written in the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –a. A horse is mentioned, among other elements from St. Mercury of Rome’s commemorative notice on Ḫǝdar 25.

additional.cont: Fol. 64va-c: Commemorative notice for St. Mercury (Märqorewos of Rome).
additional.det: Written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Mentioning elements from St. Mercury's (of Rome) commemorative notice on Ḫǝdar 25.

additional.cont: Fol. 65ra-c: ˀArke-poem for Gäbrä ˀIyäsus.
additional.det: Written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –tǝ.

additional.cont: Fol. 92va: ˀArke-poem for St. Mercury (Märqorewos of Rome).
additional.det: Written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –lo. Mentioning elements from St. Mercury's (of Rome) commemorative notice on Ḫǝdar 25.

additional.cont: Fol. 93vab: ˀArke-poem on how Gäbrä ˀIyäsus was killed by Yulyanos.
additional.det: Written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –zǝ.

additional.cont: Fol. 95va-c: ˀArke-poem for St. Mercury (Märqorewos of Rome).
additional.det: Written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –sǝ. Mentioning elements from St. Mercury's (of Rome) commemorative notice on Ḫǝdar 25.

Written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –re. Mentioning St. Mercury (of Rome), Dawit, Yaʿǝqob, and elements from St. Mercury's commemorative notice on Ḫǝdar 25

additional.cont: Fol. 136va-c: ˀArke-poem for Gäbrä ˀIyäsus.
additional.det: Written in upper margin, in a secondary hand. Rhymed ʾarke-poem with five strophes ending in –kǝ. Mentioning Gäbrä ʾIyäsus and the angel Rufaʾel.

additional.cont: Fol. 137ra-c: ˀArke-poem (for several Saints?).
additional.det: Written in upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –rä. Mentioning the black horse (of St. Mercury), Gäbrä ʾIyäsus, ʾElyas and Niqodemos.

additional.cont: Fol.181va-182rc: ˀArke-poem for St. Mercury (Märqorewos of Rome).
additional.det: Written in upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written in the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –nä Mentioning elements from St. Mercury's (of Rome) commemorative notice on Ḫǝdar 25.

additional.cont: Fol. 221vc-222rb: ˀArke-poem for Gäbrä ˀIyäsus.
additional.det: Written in upper margin, in a secondary hand (Additiones 1-11 written by the same hand). Rhymed ʾarke-poem of five lines ending in –bǝ. Mentioning Gäbrä ʾIyäsus.

additional.cont: Fol. 226vb-c: Ownership note.
additional.det:
The note is partly illegible. It is written over the decoration marks of the original scribe, and an older ownership note. The note was probably written by the same scribe who introduced the donor’s names throughout the Ms.
The Ms. was bought by the priests ʾabunä Wäldä Mikaʾel and ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot (possibly his son, cp. DMD-009) who donated it to the church of Yoḥannǝs Mäṭmǝq of Dǝbla. Ras Sǝbḥat (ʾArägawi, governor of Tǝgray with the title of ras in the years 1892-95 and 1908-14) is also mentioned

extras.extra: - Parts of notes, written in red ink at the end of the monthly readings have been erased. Only the words ዝመጽሐፍ፡ (ስንክሳር) are left: fols. 38rc, 69vc, 144vc, 226vb - Doodle in pen: fol. 64v - Tämälläs-sign indication the place where the omission belongs: fol. 199vc l.3 - Parts of column a, in fol. 3r, are re-written in a secondary hand in modern ink. - The scribe used a x symbol where too much room was left for rubrication, e.g. fols. 33ra, 103rb, 172rab, 223va.
